mva2.adapter

Class ItemViewHolder<M>

  • java.lang.Object
    • RecyclerView.ViewHolder
      • mva2.adapter.ItemViewHolder<M>

  • public class ItemViewHolder<M>
extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder
    ItemViewHolder is a wrapper class around RecyclerView.ViewHolder.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ItemViewHolder(android.view.View itemView) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDragDirections()
      Returns the drag directions for the provided ItemViewHolder.
      M getItem()
      Returns the item object bounded by this ItemViewHolder
      int getSwipeDirections()
      Returns the swipe directions for the provided ItemViewHolder.
      boolean isInActionMode() 
      boolean isItemExpanded() 
      boolean isItemSelected() 
      boolean isSectionExpanded() 
      void onClick()
      If you set the OnItemClickListener for your ListSection, call this method to get notified.
      void startDrag()
      The method lets the user to start dragging the viewholder
      void toggleItemExpansion()
      Can be called by the child view holders to toggle the ItemViewHolder's expansion status.
      void toggleItemSelection()
      Can be called by the child view holders to toggle the selection.
      void toggleSectionExpansion()
      Can be called by the child view holders to toggle the Section's expansion status.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemViewHolder

        public ItemViewHolder(android.view.View itemView)

    • Method Detail

      • getDragDirections

        public int getDragDirections()
        Returns the drag directions for the provided ItemViewHolder. Default implementation returns the drag directions as 0. This method can be overridden by child classes to provide valid drag direction flags.
        Returns:
        A binary OR of direction flags.

      • getItem

        public M getItem()
        Returns the item object bounded by this ItemViewHolder
        Returns:
        item bounded by this ItemViewHolder

      • getSwipeDirections

        public int getSwipeDirections()
        Returns the swipe directions for the provided ItemViewHolder. Default implementation returns the swipe directions as 0. This method can be overridden by child classes to provide valid swipe direction flags.
        Returns:
        A binary OR of direction flags.

      • isInActionMode

        public boolean isInActionMode()
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating whether the adapter is in context mode or not.
        See Also:
        (), ()

      • isItemExpanded

        public boolean isItemExpanded()
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating whether the viewholder is expanded or not.
        See Also:
        toggleItemExpansion()

      • isItemSelected

        public boolean isItemSelected()
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating whether the viewholder is selected or not.
        See Also:
        toggleItemSelection()

      • isSectionExpanded

        public boolean isSectionExpanded()
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating whether the viewholder is expanded or not.
        See Also:
        toggleItemExpansion()

      • onClick

        public void onClick()
        If you set the OnItemClickListener for your ListSection, call this method to get notified.

      • startDrag

        public void startDrag()
        The method lets the user to start dragging the viewholder

      • toggleItemExpansion

        public void toggleItemExpansion()
        Can be called by the child view holders to toggle the ItemViewHolder's expansion status.

      • toggleItemSelection

        public void toggleItemSelection()
        Can be called by the child view holders to toggle the selection.

      • toggleSectionExpansion

        public void toggleSectionExpansion()
        Can be called by the child view holders to toggle the Section's expansion status.
